content:
How to Find Hidden Files and Folders in Windows: 11 Steps 
 Home Random Browse Articles Notifications Add to This Page Add Tip Easy Ways to Help Approve Questions Review Tech Feedback Fix Spelling More Things to Try...   
 Log in / Sign up   
 Desktop Site   
 Talk How to Find Hidden Files and Folders in Windows   
 This wikiHow teaches you how to display and locate hidden files and folders in Windows. 
 Steps Edit 
 Part One of Two: Displaying Hidden Items Edit 
 {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/7\/78\/Find-Hidden-Files-and-Folders-in-Windows-Step-1-Version-4.jpg\/v4-460px-Find-Hidden-Files-and-Folders-in-Windows-Step-1-Version-4.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/7\/78\/Find-Hidden-Files-and-Folders-in-Windows-Step-1-Version-4.jpg\/v4-759px-Find-Hidden-Files-and-Folders-in-Windows-Step-1-Version-4.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":343.1043956044,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":566.86813186813} 
 1 
 Open the Start menu
 {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/0\/07\/Windowsstart.png","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/0\/07\/Windowsstart.png","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":460,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":760} 
.  Either click the Windows logo in the bottom-left corner of the screen, or press the  ⊞  Win  key.
 On Windows 8, hover your cursor in the top-right corner of the screen, then click the magnifying glass icon. 
 {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/4\/4a\/Find-Hidden-Files-and-Folders-in-Windows-Step-2-Version-4.jpg\/v4-460px-Find-Hidden-Files-and-Folders-in-Windows-Step-2-Version-4.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/4\/4a\/Find-Hidden-Files-and-Folders-in-Windows-Step-2-Version-4.jpg\/v4-760px-Find-Hidden-Files-and-Folders-in-Windows-Step-2-Version-4.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345.63186813187,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":571.04395604396} 
 2 
 Type  file explorer options  into Start.  This will bring up the File Explorer Options icon at the top of the search results.
 {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/4\/46\/Find-Hidden-Files-and-Folders-in-Windows-Step-3-Version-4.jpg\/v4-460px-Find-Hidden-Files-and-Folders-in-Windows-Step-3-Version-4.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/4\/46\/Find-Hidden-Files-and-Folders-in-Windows-Step-3-Version-4.jpg\/v4-760px-Find-Hidden-Files-and-Folders-in-Windows-Step-3-Version-4.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":343.73626373626,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":567.91208791209} 
 3 
 Click  File Explorer Options .  It's the folder-shaped icon at the top of the Start window.
 {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/2\/2b\/Find-Hidden-Files-and-Folders-in-Windows-Step-4-Version-4.jpg\/v4-460px-Find-Hidden-Files-and-Folders-in-Windows-Step-4-Version-4.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/2\/2b\/Find-Hidden-Files-and-Folders-in-Windows-Step-4-Version-4.jpg\/v4-760px-Find-Hidden-Files-and-Folders-in-Windows-Step-4-Version-4.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":342.47252747253,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":565.82417582418} 
 4 
 Click the  View  tab.  You'll see it at the top of the File Explorer Options window.
 {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/7\/7b\/Find-Hidden-Files-and-Folders-in-Windows-Step-5-Version-4.jpg\/v4-459px-Find-Hidden-Files-and-Folders-in-Windows-Step-5-Version-4.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/7\/7b\/Find-Hidden-Files-and-Folders-in-Windows-Step-5-Version-4.jpg\/v4-759px-Find-Hidden-Files-and-Folders-in-Windows-Step-5-Version-4.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":348.79120879121,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":576.26373626374} 
 5 
 Click the  Show hidden files, folders, and drives  circle.  It should be in the middle of the "Advanced settings" window.
 If you don't see this option, double-click the  Hidden files and folders  line of text. If you don't see that option either, first double-click  Files and Folders  at the top of the "Advanced settings" window. 
 {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/b\/ba\/Find-Hidden-Files-and-Folders-in-Windows-Step-6-Version-4.jpg\/v4-460px-Find-Hidden-Files-and-Folders-in-Windows-Step-6-Version-4.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/b\/ba\/Find-Hidden-Files-and-Folders-in-Windows-Step-6-Version-4.jpg\/v4-760px-Find-Hidden-Files-and-Folders-in-Windows-Step-6-Version-4.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":343.73626373626,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":567.91208791209} 
 6 
 Click  Apply , then click  OK .  Both of these buttons are at the bottom of the window. Doing so will reveal any hidden files, folders, drives, and other items on your computer.
 Advertisement 
 Part Two of Two: Searching Edit 
 {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/a\/aa\/Find-Hidden-Files-and-Folders-in-Windows-Step-7-Version-4.jpg\/v4-460px-Find-Hidden-Files-and-Folders-in-Windows-Step-7-Version-4.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/a\/aa\/Find-Hidden-Files-and-Folders-in-Windows-Step-7-Version-4.jpg\/v4-760px-Find-Hidden-Files-and-Folders-in-Windows-Step-7-Version-4.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345.63186813187,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":571.04395604396} 
 1 
 Open File Explorer
 {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/b\/b1\/WindowsFileExplorer.png","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/b\/b1\/WindowsFileExplorer.png","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":460,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":760} 
.  This app is the folder-shaped icon on your taskbar.
 You can also type  file explorer  into Start and then press  ↵  Enter . 
 {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/2\/24\/Find-Hidden-Files-and-Folders-in-Windows-Step-8-Version-4.jpg\/v4-460px-Find-Hidden-Files-and-Folders-in-Windows-Step-8-Version-4.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/2\/24\/Find-Hidden-Files-and-Folders-in-Windows-Step-8-Version-4.jpg\/v4-760px-Find-Hidden-Files-and-Folders-in-Windows-Step-8-Version-4.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570} 
 2 
 Click your hard drive's name.  It's in the left-hand column of options. In most cases, this will be  OS (C:) .
 {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/5\/51\/Find-Hidden-Files-and-Folders-in-Windows-Step-9-Version-4.jpg\/v4-460px-Find-Hidden-Files-and-Folders-in-Windows-Step-9-Version-4.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/5\/51\/Find-Hidden-Files-and-Folders-in-Windows-Step-9-Version-4.jpg\/v4-759px-Find-Hidden-Files-and-Folders-in-Windows-Step-9-Version-4.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":344.36813186813,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":568.95604395604} 
 3 
 Click the search bar.  It's in the top-right corner of the File Explorer window.
 {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/f\/f7\/Find-Hidden-Files-and-Folders-in-Windows-Step-10-Version-4.jpg\/v4-460px-Find-Hidden-Files-and-Folders-in-Windows-Step-10-Version-4.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/f\/f7\/Find-Hidden-Files-and-Folders-in-Windows-Step-10-Version-4.jpg\/v4-760px-Find-Hidden-Files-and-Folders-in-Windows-Step-10-Version-4.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":346.26373626374,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":572.08791208791} 
 4 
 Type in the name of a hidden item.  If you don't know the item's name, try typing an asterisk and then the item's file type (e.g., typing "*.jpg" will show results for all jpeg images that end in the filetype ".jpg").
 {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/d\/db\/Find-Hidden-Files-and-Folders-in-Windows-Step-11-Version-3.jpg\/v4-460px-Find-Hidden-Files-and-Folders-in-Windows-Step-11-Version-3.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/d\/db\/Find-Hidden-Files-and-Folders-in-Windows-Step-11-Version-3.jpg\/v4-760px-Find-Hidden-Files-and-Folders-in-Windows-Step-11-Version-3.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570} 
 5 
 Review the results.  You should see several hidden folders and files here.
 These files and folders are not accessible from the Start search. 
 If you don't see your desired hidden file, folder, or other item, click  This PC  in the left-hand column and run your search again. 
 Advertisement 
 Community Q&A 
 Search 
 Add New Question 
 What is command prompt and how does it work? 
								Answered by  
								wikiHow Contributor							 
 Command prompt is displayed as a tab on your computer, and can be opened from the "Start" menu. You can also simply click the Windows key and the R key, then type "CMD" in the search bar. It allows you to send certain commands and get information or change information. 
 Thanks! 
 6 
 2 
 I took the hard disk out and transferred the data from another computer to the hard disk using a data cable, but I can't find the data. What should I do? 
								Answered by  
								wikiHow Contributor							 
 Click Options in the top of your explorer window and select Show Hidden Files. Alternatively you can just search Windows settings for "hidden files" and there will be an option to view hidden files. Enable it. 
 Thanks!

 Tips Edit 
 If you don't know your hidden file's or folder's name, consider looking up its location online before searching for it.

 Warnings Edit 
 Deleting system files will often render your version of Windows unstable or, in some cases, completely inoperable.
